pros: Resources to invest in buildings, residents and people

review_title: Theory and Practice Do Not Match
job_title: Recreation Assistant in Monroe Township, NJ
pros: Most co-workers help you when you need it.
cons: My job title was Recreation Assistant however my job description and duties included serving meals, washing dishes, helping residents eat their meals, doing resident laundry. In addition to providing recreational activities. Non administrative staff were expected to do all job functions (they called it being a universal worker) yet administration rarely, if ever was seen doing dishes, helping residents with their meals or doing dishes. When the multiple tasks were interrupting my primary job they responded "It's a challenge." Sure " it's a challenge" . It becomes a problem only until administration has to deal with it personally. Too many managers and disorganized. I had a problem with a resident family member who made unwanted advances toward me. They shoved the incident under the carpet and did not address the situation with the family member. They were still permitted to be on the unit when I was present.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Highland Park, NJ
pros: Benefits are great if you are looking for stability and comfort, a majority of people there are doing the bare minimum ( especially in upper management )  so it's not a stressful environment.
cons: Since it is a company where many employees have been here for 10+ years it leaves room for a lot of LAZY individuals who are not open to learning and growing. They are stuck in their ways and only want to continue doing what has worked for them even though internally the organization is failing. Growth and change is needed in order for there to be any room for improvements.

job_title: Nursing Manager in Highland Park, NJ
cons: Very political and clicks.  If you aren't part of the game then you are on the outside looking in.  Management is very top heavy with minimal qualified support staff.  Stay away till they get their act together.

pros: Staff very attentive & easily work together towards the same goals, fair patient to nurse ratio, average pay, fairly decent benefits
